title: MasTec Q2 Earnings in-Line with Estimates, Revenues Lag
text:
Content preferences Done MasTec, Inc. MTZ reported-second quarter 2015 adjusted earnings (excluding one-time items barring non-cash stock compensation expense) of 8 cents per share, in line with the Zacks Consensus Estimate but a significant drop from 39 cents per share earned in the prior-year quarter. Earnings declined due to the adverse impact of rain and flooding across multiple segments as well as significant disruptions within the Electrical Transmission segment. Including one-time items, MasTec posted a loss of 5 cents per share as against year-ago quarter’s earnings of 39 cents. Second-quarter earnings include non-operating and non-core charges, composed primarily of the WesTower acquisition integration costs, Audit Committee investigation related costs and the nonrecurring impact of an income tax law change in Alberta, Canada. Mastec Inc. - Earnings Surprise | FindTheBest 
Operational Update MasTec’s net sales decreased 4% year on year to $1.07 billion in the quarter. Revenues also fell short of the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.02 billion. Revenues in the Oil and Gas segment increased 12% to $411 million and in the Power Generation and Industrial segment improved 9% to $103 million. Sales in Electrical Transmission decreased 33% year over year to $78 million and in the Communication segment it went down 11% to $469 million. Cost of sales in the quarter decreased 1% year over year to $946 million. Gross profit declined 23% to $121 million from $157 million in the year-ago quarter. Gross margin contracted 280 basis points to 11.3% in the quarter. General and administrative expenses increased 28% year over year to $69 million. Operating profit declined 88% to $8.2 million in the quarter from $65.5 million in the prior-year quarter. Consequently, operating margin contracted 510 basis points (bps) year over year to 0.8%. Adjusted earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA) were $71 million as against $109 million in the prior-year quarter. Financial Details MasTec ended the second quarter with cash and cash equivalents of $4.8 million, down from $15.9 million at the end of the year-ago quarter. The company generated cash flow from operations of $166 million in the first half of 2015 compared to cash usage of $55.3 million in the prior-year comparable period. Long-term debt was $1.14 billion as of Jun 30, 2015 compared with $1.06 billion as of Dec 31, 2014. Guidance For 2015, MasTec expects adjusted earnings per share between 73 cents and 83 cents on the back of revenues of $4.2 billion to $4.3 billion. Adjusted EBITDA is projected in a range of $325 million to $340 million. For the third quarter of 2015, MasTec expects adjusted earnings per share between 31 cents to 37 cents, revenue of $1.1 billion to $1.2 billion and adjusted EBITDA between $100 million to $108 million.Coral Gables, FL-based MasTec is a leading infrastructure construction company that operates primarily in North America and caters to a range of industries. Its services include engineering, building, installation, maintenance and upgrade of energy, utility and communications infrastructure as well as industrial infrastructure.At present, MasTec has a Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell).Some better-ranked stocks in the construction sector are Dycom Industries Inc. DY, Chicago Bridge & Iron Company N.V. CBI and EMCOR Group Inc. EME.
